aprilWitchEn.title: April Witch
aprilWitchEn.quote: “(A) ferocious, spellbinding story… completely mesmerizing (…) April Witch will possess you and make you see the world with different eyes.”  - The Washington Post

rosarioEn.title: Rosario is dead
rosarioEn.quote: In this documentary-novel, Majgull Axelsson tells Rosario Baluyots story. She died at age 11, having lived in the streets of Olongapo in the Philippines until she died the victim of the ruthless sex-tourism industry.

denJagAldrigVarEn.title: The Woman I Never Was
denJagAldrigVarEn.quote: ”The Woman I Never Was is on one of its many planes a mercilessly cruel generational novel (...) Majgull Axelsson writes with unrelenting bleakness and consequence” – Expressen

dittLivOchMittEn.title: Your life and mine
dittLivOchMittEn.quote: This is an authors work that has since its debut been in the service of the weak (...) We need her voice more today than ever before. - Svenska Dagbladet

isOchVattenEn.title: Ice and Water, Water and Ice
isOchVattenEn.quote: ... one of contemporary Swedish literatures sharpest decpiter of the everyday, families, class and their interactions. - Dagens Nyheter

moderspassionEn.title: Mother's Passion
moderspassionEn.quote: ... One of our greatest storytellers - Vi magazine

miriamEn.title: My Name Is Not Miriam(Jag heter inte Miriam)
miriamEn.quote: A story that bears repeating, again and again. Majgull Axelsson does it honor. - Svenska Dagbladet

slumpvandringEn.title: Random House
slumpvandringEn.quote: Random House is a book that you read from cover to cover - Nerikes Allehanda

nifelheimEn.title: Far away from Nifelheim
nifelheimEn.quote: Seldom if ever has a book touched me more strongly than Majgull Axelssons debutnovel, Far Away from Nifelheim. It is straight, naked and honest. - UNT

isOchVattenSV.title: Is och vatten, vatten och is
